website_summaries.verdict: Easily install this smart switch and dimmer and you'll never have to worry about leaving lights on again.
pros: Boasts ability to dim electronically or with physical switch if desired
Is straightforward to install and comes with in-depth instructions
Possesses the ability to schedule lighting and reports energy usage
Compatible with many smart home systemsl
cons: Requires a neutral wire for installation
May be larger than a standard light switch

customer_reviews.title: They work with Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: YES this works with Comcast/Xfinity home security systems. I have 13 of these installed, they all show up on the mobile app and on the home screen/monitor. When you read the how to from Xfinity they talk about a "air gap" these don't have this, these may be a updated version. They are a little larger than a normal light switch but I had no trouble installing them in the rough-in boxes (single, double and even in a box with 3 switches). I would buy them again if I had any more switches that I wanted to control from my Xfinity home security system.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Awesome .... way a smart switch should be!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice switch with awesome features. Along with dimming and energy monitoring capabilities, it can also be used as standalone or as 3 or 4 way along with Add-on switches which costs like $20 each. Integration with SmartThings was flawless. Main switch automatically syncs with Add-On switches and hence no additional configuration needed. SmartThings to Google Assistant (Phone, Wear and Android TV) was again flawless for voice activated commands. Very economical and more feature rich compared to other plain one way and non-dimming switches like from Wemo and TP-Link.
customer_reviews.author: HSB

customer_reviews.title: Great home automation solution
customer_reviews.text: Works great. But I would say to watch the YouTube videos on how to install rather than trying to decipher their written instructions. Got it working with the Amazon Echo Plus (Alexa) in no time. This product has the look and feel of a regular rocker switch. The look just like regular rocker switches and look fine mounted right next to a regular rocker switch. I also have some wi-fi switches in my house and those are just a flat surface and look out of place when mounted next to other switches. You can install multiples of these Zigbee rocker switches right next to each other in a multi-switch box, unlike the wi-fi switches I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Wynia

customer_reviews.title: Died after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This zigbee switch worked well with Amazon Echo Plus at first. Alexa would turn it on and off. After about 5 months, the physical switch stopped working. So Alexa voice commands were the only way we could operate the switch. About 5 months later, everything stopped working. The lifespan was completely unacceptable for something you have to hardwire into your house. I would whole heartedly recommend buying a smart thing that was easily replaceable as opposed to one that gets hard wired.
customer_reviews.author: jamespf

customer_reviews.title: Great performance - but GE should re-design the device size
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Works perfectly. Very easy to do the initial configuration. Work perfectly with Alexa. Absolutely no complains functionally. Dislikes: Physically it is a bit too large. Difficult to install in electric boxes containing other switches. The requirement of a neutral wire makes installation even more difficult. I used a Wiremold electric box extender and I had to cut part of its back to fit this GE dimmer. All in all, this device if functionally excellent and if you don't mind exercising your handyman abilities then this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: MVar

customer_reviews.title: Loses connectivity too often
customer_reviews.text: I have a few brands of smart devices (switches, receptacles, bulbs, etc.) that communicate with my smartthings hub/repeater and this device loses connectivity the most - by far, despite it being reasonably close to the hub (2 interior walls away in a conventional stick frame house). My other devices are either upstairs or equally as far and don't have persistent issues. I've tried pulling the spark gap per the manual a bunch of times and it is hit and miss for solving this issue. Connectivity issues aside, it's been dimming our fixture with LED bulbs just fine for a year now and installation went fine. That said, I'll stick with Leviton and other brands, which I've had more success with.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon J

customer_reviews.title: Worked with Echo Plus for 12 months only
customer_reviews.text: It paired with my echo plus on purchase easily. It worked for 12 months. Now it is is no longer recognized by the echo and even after resetting it back to pairing mode it is unable to pair with my echo plus at all. I purchased two of these. Both have the exact same problem. Not sure if the problem is the plug, the crappy hub that's built into the echo plus, or Amazon's crap smart home software. Either way, both of them are now useless after 12 months. I certainly wouldn't certify this echo plus compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent, Good Construction
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap, but worth it I think. These switches are of higher quality than many others I have seen on the market. Though they waste away a fair amount of electricity as heat as has been pointed out in other reviews I do like the functionality and the reasonable dimmer curve. I have installed several of these and their accessory switches in my house and I am happy except for the wasted energy. They control both incandescent and LED loads without issue, and with predictability.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: 500ms delay when pushed
customer_reviews.text: There is a 500ms delay even when you push the button manually. I wrote to Jasco support (they make these switches for GE) and asked for ways to get rid of that delay via a firmware update but they didn't seem interested in giving this any real thought. 500ms is annoyingly long, so I will not get more of these and need to figure out what to do about the ones I already have.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Great otem5,working good, Alexa enabled
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I'm getting to be a "smart home" pro. I've installed lots of lights, switches. plugs. Etc. These were a snap, so well done. Wired up, and Alexa detected them immediately and was up and done. Re-name them in the app and your done. Very happy with these,and will purchased more. Now. I don't know yet what will happen when the power goes out, then when its back on if they will boot up auto or if I will have to re do the Alexa thing, but so far work great. I'm buy two more
customer_reviews.author: Starman

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with Echo Plus! It was installed in the four gang box to replace the existing (non-smart) dimmer. My only wish is that the price will come down so that the rest of the dimmers around the house can be replaced soon. Since this dimmer works with Echo Plus built-in hub, there is no need install additional proprietary hub or skill. Happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: tinker bell

customer_reviews.title: Wink stated that while the device will work with the system the Zwave version works best. I purchased the second device and that GE ...
customer_reviews.text: The item worked well however the reason it was purchased was to work with my Wink Zwave system. The box states the it works with the foresaid system. However when I received the device and tried to pair with my system, I had trouble and spent time trying to get it to connect before contacting Wink directly. Wink informed me that GE makes two devices that perform this function. GE indicates that both devices on the packaging work with Wink. Wink stated that while the device will work with the system the Zwave version works best. I purchased the second device and that GE plug has been great. Five stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: sergio

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the Echo Plus
customer_reviews.text: Installation was relatively easy. The body of the switch is VERY large, so it can get a bit cramped inside the electrical box, especially if you have more than one (or a large timer switch). If there's any plaster or irregularities in the drywall around the box the installation is going to become a lot more difficult, so clear that stuff away first if you can. Works perfectly with the Amazon Echo Plus. Pairing was fairly easy, though I did have to try twice to get Alexa to find it.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Packrat

customer_reviews.title: Use Zigbee for Home Automation!
customer_reviews.text: My home had X10, but on/off was about 50% reliable. After a lot of research, I switched from X10 to Zigbee. Zigbee is the same wireless transport that is used by Thread. (Think "Nest Thermostat"!) Note: Remember that Z-Wave in NOT compatible with Zigbee. These GE Zigbee in-wall switches have very good range. On/off is now 100% reliable for my home. I have 8 of these and will buy a few more. I am using the Samsung SmartHub. Now, I would like to find some Zigbee in-wall outlets to replace all my X10 in-wall outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Nema

customer_reviews.title: When it worked it was fine, but seems like 2 switches failed out of ...
customer_reviews.text: The switch failed 3 days after return policy expired. This is the 2nd switch that failed (1st one failed after 6 months in different location). When it worked it was fine, but seems like 2 switches failed out of the 6 I bought - that's too high of a rate
customer_reviews.author: wizcw

customer_reviews.title: Best And Most Responsive Alexa Switches
customer_reviews.text: We have use these throughout our home to make it a smart house. The switches are amazing and very responsive to Alexa commands. Meanwhile my son utilized the Z wave technology and has experienced long delays between giving Alexa the command and the action occurring. He is now in the process of replacing all of his Z wave switches with these. The switches are slightly more expensive. But absolutely worth the money difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy configuration with Echo Plus.
customer_reviews.text: It’s nice to have a switch that you can tap to turn lights on or off with the option to control by voice. More convenient than a bulb that is ZigBee controlled. I paired this with my Echo Plus, very easy pairing. Hopefully there will be more devices created that are ZigBee controlled. Looks like there are more Zwave options.
customer_reviews.author: Willard J. Tank

customer_reviews.title: Short life after warranty expired.
customer_reviews.text: Two of these were purchased and paired with an Xfinity alarm system. They worked well for 2 years and two months, but both then failed with one week of another. Deleted, wires removed, reinstalled, paired to the alarm, but they had a mind of there own. Turn on/off by alarm, then turn themselves back on or off. The manual switch stopped responding as well. Too expensive for such a short use.
customer_reviews.author: DeLevin

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. I use it to adjust the brightness of string lights I have around my living room and it easily controllable with my Echo or the Alexa app on my phone. I had originally purchased a different brand of dimmer plug and it was a nightmare. I returned it and bought this item and it was so much better. I was able to get it set up easily on the first try and it has operated perfectly since.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for all of my ceiling fans. Have been using them for over a year with no failures, even in the kitchen which has two fans on the same switch. Amazon echo plus works great to communicate with them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Black listed by Xfinity Home
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 because I wanted them specifically to pair to my Xfinity Home app.... GE products are suppose to be approved. However - Product is made by Jasco... and will not sync with the system - Cost me a service call to find this out. Even thou the BOX clearly say Xfinity Home on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S. Gabelica

customer_reviews.title: GE w/ Zigbee works great
customer_reviews.text: Got an Alexa Ech Plus 3gen and love it. The deal came with a Philips Hue bulb that I don’t love because it flickers when dimed. I got the plus for the Zigbee hub built in and purchased the GE dimmer to power & control my living room lighting - this I love. The switch works perfectly and provides Alexa, manual, or app control. The Hue system still requires a hub unless you are using individual bulbs, which can be $$! To each their own but Zigbee tech is perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: would buy again...and did
customer_reviews.text: helped me expand the zigbee portion of my network. once i got a couple zigbee units where i wanted them this worked real well in helping expand. GE makes a good switch. Now if only theyd make more traditional style switches instead of focusing so much on the rockers.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The voice control via the echo plus makes this pretty cool... My lazy ass can sit on the couch and tell alexa to dim the lights to 10% or turn them off for a movie... I don't love it for manual use, as you have to hold the paddle for a few seconds till it starts to turn on or off, but I don't plan on using it that way and it does EXACTLY what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jason N.

customer_reviews.title: Please read.
customer_reviews.text: This smart switch will work and pair the issue however is that when toggled on and off it will be delayed. When physically using the light switch it is slower that using your phone...a second delay. Others have had this issue, I should have done research before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome with Echo Plus!!!
customer_reviews.text: Call me lazy but I used these to replace the light and fan switch in my master bedroom. Now instead of having to get up to try off the light after I'm in bed or turn the fan on or off in the middle of the night when it is hot/cold I can just tell Alexa to turn off the light or turn on the fan!! It's awesome
customer_reviews.author: SinCityLV

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Cox Homelife security
customer_reviews.text: It's not compatable with Cox Homelife, at least latest Cox update as of 11/18/18. I finally got it to pair but it would not turn on or off a light or other device plugged in. Cox technicians had the same problem. GE and Jascoo (theri manufacturer) said they don't guarantee or support it working iwth Cox Homelife and it's not their responsibility to do so (!!)
customer_reviews.author: B. H.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me. Only thing to note, ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well for me. Only thing to note, is this product is much bigger than a normal wall switch. If you are using this for a two-gang or three-gang box, you may have to clip the pieces that are sticking out on the end. Was the only way they would fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of these for to use in a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for to use in a box with three light switches. I left one regular switch in the box. I could not get a wallplate to fit with these two switches in there. They have those metal lips on the sides of the switches which makes them take up more space with two side by side. I ended up having the modify a lightswitch plate to get it to fit.
customer_reviews.author: D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The switch is easy to install and works great it connected just fine to my Samsung SmartThings hub this is the first zigbee switch I've bought and installed it functions the same as the Z-Wave. I found that while installing them once I'm ready to turn the power supply to the switch if I have the Hub in discovery mode it seems to connect right up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect without a hub
customer_reviews.text: Information is misleading. It states that you can connect to Echo device without a hub. Tried to connect it to our Alexa Echo Show - it requires a hub. Tried downloading the Zigbee app - to see if I needed to connect to that first - but that looked for a hub as well. Looks like the only way to get this to work is to buy a hub. Would return it - if in fact I did not have two switches already installed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Myhre

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey, but works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: I'm running my home automation via a Smarthings hub. This switch was painless to discover and integrate (which is more than I can say for many other devices in the array). Functionality is terrific. Plug any old light into it, and you can control/dim the same way you would a smart bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Ecto Malt

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with my LEDs
customer_reviews.text: This dimmer works great with incandescent bulbs, but I wanted to use it with a string of LED bulbs. When plugged in to this dimmer the LEDs would never fully turn off! When the switch was off, the LEDs would still glow faintly.
customer_reviews.author: 9Life42

customer_reviews.title: Need nuetral - if you don’t have one use the ground and bridge or jump a wire from neutral to ground
customer_reviews.text: Product works fine once you get it hooked up. Directions were vague at best. It requires a neutral wire. If you do not have one use the Ground and bridge to neutral. Worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Freitag

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really work with Wink Hub
customer_reviews.text: False advertising. I can see the switch in the app and I sit there and try to pair it for hours. Not working. Pair it as a generic zigbee bulb and it works, but now the switch doesn't work. Probably going to send all five back!
customer_reviews.author: JTompkins

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: 1 year later and the only thing that supports it are the screws. Yeah, technology moves fast but this is GE for god’s sake! That’s why it’s no longer available on Amazon new. Trash.
customer_reviews.author: Al SwansonTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Great switch but doesn't fix in metal enclosures without heavy modification
customer_reviews.text: Works great with SmartThings and had little trouble pairing it with my hub. This switch does NOT fit well in the metal box enclosures you typically see in garages and basements. I had to use a hacksaw and pliers to modify the metal frame around the switch to fit inside a standard 4" receptacle box in my garage. Other than that, it was easy to install and now my outdoor flood lights have a dimmer and can be controlled by my phone!
customer_reviews.author: A. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We had an electrician install it for us since I didn't want to screw it up. We connected it to our Alexa and put a schedule on it so our outside lights turn on automatically every night of the week. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I have my coffee pot plugged into it. Before I even get out of the bed, "Alexa, turn on the coffee pot"! Pairing it with Alexa was easy and quick. The only reason for the 4 star rating is it's only a smart plug on one side. The other side is always on.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: looks nice but won't work with grounded (3 prong) plugs
customer_reviews.text: I should have looked and read the info more carefully. This will only allow control for a device that doesn't have a ground plug. The passthrough has it but the control side doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: akasleepy

customer_reviews.title: Great range, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Installed these as the only Zigbee switches in PAN and approximately 45 feet from hub going through three wood stud walls and one with plumbing in the wall. Connected up fine, never lost signal to the hub. Wish I could test at 60 feet and see if they still connect. Connected to Wink2 hub just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Potter

customer_reviews.title: Works great with smartthings
customer_reviews.text: Bought an inovelli smart switch that said it worked with smartthings. It never worked properly, so I decided to give this GE one a try. I hooked it up and it instantly connected. Works perfectly. Spend the extra $10 for a quality product that works.
customer_reviews.author: M. Takacs

customer_reviews.title: Can NOT be included in Alexa routine setup
customer_reviews.text: Echo Pro found and connected to this device without a single problem. Device can be “manually” or “voiced” controlled via Alexa, however it does not show up as a useable device (in the Alexa app) when setting up an on/off routine. Therefore, it can NOT be set to automatically turned on or off in the Alexa app. For my application this makes the device absolutely worthless. Sending it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: hickamcasa

customer_reviews.title: Smart Energy reporting plug, great Zigbee repeater!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, reports energy and does what it says. Using with Smartthings. Extends my weak ZigBee signal nicely so there's less dropping Hue light bulbs in the house. Need more ZigBee repeaters? Buy this.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna Banana

customer_reviews.title: Yes, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I have installed these GE ZigBee Smart switches throughout my house; especially for my outside lighting. I love the fact that I can turn the lights on or off no matter where I am.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Bother if Using Echo Plus
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to control my outside lights based on the product description. However, if you are planning on using the Echo Plus as your smart hub, don’t bother. You can only turn the switch off and on with the Alexa app and voice controls. You can’t program any scenes or routines, which I think makes the switch and the Echo Plus pretty useless. I called for advice and was told the Alexa scenes function has known issues and could not discover divorces.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Loeffler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hooked it up to a table lamp with an Edison bulb and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: merlin4

customer_reviews.title: Works beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Works beautiful! Included this switch to my Logitech Harmony Home Hub Extender, setup was very easy, love it. Included this switch to my activities on the Harmony remote and it does work wonderful switching on and off some cooling fans as soon as I turn my receiver on.
customer_reviews.author: S+S Florida

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product by GE, works great. Just wish it could change indicator light settings like the z wave does. But otherwise way better than wemo dimmers, and cheaper too.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kazery

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This product is garbage. I didn't have an issue connecting it to my echo but the damn plug stopped working after the third day of use. Do not waste your money on this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier J

customer_reviews.title: Need a neutral wire to use.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I missed the part where one MUST have a neutral wire which is why I only rated it a 4 star--feel like the newer listings for these switches make it more plain the wiring requirements.
customer_reviews.author: KAMaertzig

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Set up was easy just read the instructions to pair direct to Echo Plus. Installation not so easy but that's the fault of a cramped electrical box. This switch is larger and I needed to trim back excess wires in box to make room...not the fault of the switch. You may have to hire an electrician if your not comfortable with this. Some times actually using the wall switch there is a slight delay or needs second click. Using voice control is great with no delay.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W.

customer_reviews.title: It works well with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: This works great with Alexa. You just need to be careful to get the right one. Controlling the switch versus bulbs means less versitile lighting but less expensive to control multiple fixtures. Mine is for 10 kitchen LED can lights. ON OFF AND DIM.
customer_reviews.author: D2

customer_reviews.title: GE is my go to.
customer_reviews.text: just like every other smart switch ive used my only complaint is the depth of the unit...just like every other smart switch ive used. Aside from that GE has been my go too and the ZigBee version is just as good as all my Z-Wave. Now if they'd just make this and the fan control in a standard switch design I'd be set.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for turning on lights for pets or setting up ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the bomb! I have installed 6 of these on lights and ceiling fans. Perfect for turning on lights for pets or setting up groups for multiple fixtures on or off with just one command. I use mine thru Alexa. Super easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: twd65

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO SET-UP
customer_reviews.text: Great instructions and super easy to connect to Xfinity Home. Would give six stars if I could!
customer_reviews.author: ANDY

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, just know that you will have to connect the neutral wire.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, just know that you will have to connect the neutral wire. In my case the neutral is bonded to the ground so I was able to use the ground on a couple of switches when there was no neutral in the box. This may not be totally OK, but it works. Discovered easily with Echo Plus.
customer_reviews.author: cfs3user

customer_reviews.title: it works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this hoping it will work with Wink, it doesn't. It says on the box that it does, but it's false advertising. Called Wink support, they told me that even though some products will say they work with Wink, doesn't mean they actually do. Wink doesn't have a hardware profile for this switch. Returned it and bought the Z-Wave version, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Wirth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and setup with Echo 2
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. It does not work with my Phillips Hue, but works well with Amazon Echo 2. Easily controls outside lights using a time schedule on the Echo. Looks great and the local indicator light on the switch shows its status.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Computer Geek

customer_reviews.title: Severe quality problems with electrical output
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work. I’ve attempted to use two now, having replaced the first after it repeatedly burned out bulbs in a lamp. From testing the output when on, the first unit delivers a highly variable current which caused flickering and burn out. A second unit leaked current and the light was still illuminated when off. I would avoid and go for an alternative product if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I am no electrician but this is pretty easy to install once I figured it out. It works very well with Amazon Alexa. I put several of these in around the house and “groups them so one command turns on or off several switches.
customer_reviews.author: twd65

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions and you'll be fine
customer_reviews.text: This switch linked up to my Hubitat Elevation hub with no issues...after I read...and followed the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: You need to know how to wire electrical switches, not for the beginner.
customer_reviews.text: This was harder to program then needed. Other wise it works fine and does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Trip

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Allows you to be selective in multi-gang boxes. Instructions are clear, and all parts needed are included.
customer_reviews.author: The Salmon Of Doubt

customer_reviews.title: Great Dimmer, works well with Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: It took me some time to finally find a video walking me through setup with Alexa and my echo plus. Once I did it took one minute. It works so well! I can adjust the power and the brightness on my phone or by asking Alexa. It’s just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob D Cox

customer_reviews.title: Smart Dimmer Plug-In 2-Outlet Lighting Control & Xfinity Home
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Smart Dimmer Plug-In 2-Outlet Lighting Control to work with my Xfinity Home. Paired perfectly, worked with the app, and rules.
customer_reviews.author: Eeek (Jim)

customer_reviews.title: Works like a Charm
customer_reviews.text: This works like a charm with Echo Plus and turns on my single-cup coffeemaker in the morning with a voice command whenever I might wake up. Another controls my LED strips stuck behind my big TV - handy.
customer_reviews.author: mavn

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product and does exactly what I purchased it for (dimming light fixtures with ECHO).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Although a little expensive, it works really well with ...
customer_reviews.text: Although a little expensive, it works really well with smartThings app and also with Alexa. It was a little more complicated to install, so I had an electrician them for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Costley

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Works well. Good as an extender for Vera.
customer_reviews.author: D.

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly As Advertised - Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Simple to set up using the Alexa app and works flawlessly to turn our lights on and off, both manually, as well as through the Alexa app and routines created in the app. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't dim all the way down on my 40W LEDs. Leaves them on slightly lit when on off setting.
customer_reviews.author: Stephan A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup and installation, about 5 minutes with unpacking, install and setup. Works as advertised with my Echo Plus. I highly recommend this switch as long as you are using it with a zigbee hub.
customer_reviews.author: Script

customer_reviews.title: Nice dimmer and works with Echo Plus
customer_reviews.text: The dimmer switch was easy to install as well as setup and use with Alexa. The best is that it works with the Echo Plus without the need for an additional third-party hub.
customer_reviews.author: JoB

customer_reviews.title: Wrong model - Was sent 43076, not 45856
customer_reviews.text: I made sure which model I selected when ordering. The 43076 model does not monitor power, where as the 45856 does.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently using this smart switch to control my 3D printer (as it's located in a cabinet away from my computer). I haven't had any issues with over-heating or power continuity. Easily connected to smart hub & Alexa for voice control.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: easy setup, i have several ge products for alexa ...
customer_reviews.text: easy setup, i have several ge products for alexa and all work great. i bought one off brand and am stuck with junk because i didnt try it quick. beware TP-Link Smart Plug
customer_reviews.author: mysticman76

customer_reviews.title: just like the z wave edition
customer_reviews.text: Hardware looks, feels, and works the same as the Z wave versions, bought this one in zigbee so it could act as a repeater on the far side of the house to other battery zigbee devices.
customer_reviews.author: BuyItOnce

customer_reviews.title: Pricey light switch ... but worth the extra cost !
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I replaced a bunch of light switches in our primary home and vacation home with these ZigBee switches. Installing the switch and connecting to SmartThings was quick and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Don Y

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Followed the install but the APP does not work and the update will not install. wasted time and money. I will try to return and get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Janice C Bonfiglio

customer_reviews.title: Love these switches - Works with SmartThings!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to work with my SmartThings hub. I have a couple of them installed and I can only say good things. Love these switches!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Drew H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent installation instructions
customer_reviews.text: Excellent installation instructions. Made the install very easy. Works with my home security system's automation features. Note: If installing in 3 way switch outlets,then you need to purchase the GE Add-On Switch -
customer_reviews.author: JCornelio

customer_reviews.title: Does not work if you have only two wires connected ...
customer_reviews.text: Does not work if you have only two wires connected to your present switch. They should clearly state that - I would not have purchased if I had known.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Postel

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install, Easy Setup, bonus energy monitoring
customer_reviews.text: Great add-on to my smart home system. Easy install, just like other in-wall switches. Installs side-by-side in multi-switch boxes. Easy setup with my Smartthings hub. Bonus: comes with easy to change white and ivory switch Extra bonus: monitors energy use thru switch.
customer_reviews.author: Mike May

customer_reviews.title: Great item for electric control
customer_reviews.text: This makes our Echoplus much more functional. No need for a hub and we can control one plug/light.
customer_reviews.author: LURKER 1

customer_reviews.title: Best light switch
customer_reviews.text: This switch works amazingly well. Working great with smartthings and Amazon echo. Installed it in upstairs bathroom as kids never turn the light off. Now just tell Alexa to turn it off. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: PHou

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back
customer_reviews.text: You gotta have additional things for it to work over WIFI
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Francois

customer_reviews.title: Home Automation Made Easy
customer_reviews.text: If you can read, follow instructions and turn a screw driver, you can install this switch. It pairs easily with Echo Plus and does not require another hub. Voice commands turn on, off and dimming. I have a few of these in select lighting locations.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works well with SmartThinkgs. I have installed over 10 of them and they work A LOT better than Zwave controllers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Loveland

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to install. This is going to be one of many I will be installing.
customer_reviews.author: joechef1

customer_reviews.title: These worked out great. Have not hear any complaints from my parents ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked out great. Have not hear any complaints from my parents after I installed them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Z Wave would have been better for me.
customer_reviews.text: These work great but if I were to do it again I would get the Z Wave version.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Not for all dimmable bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Was able to get it synced with a Samsung hub and give it commands but it did not work with suitable LEDs that do dim properly on a manual lamp dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J.

customer_reviews.title: Defective part
customer_reviews.text: Did not work the first time. Will try again next one.
customer_reviews.author: N Tapi

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works with Xfinity Home. I have it to automatically turn on and off at designated times.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Glad the prices are finally dropping on these smart light ...
customer_reviews.text: Glad the prices are finally dropping on these smart light switches. The instructions are good but you need some amature electrician aptitude to figure things out if you're doing a THREE WAY switching unit (which you'll also need the "add on" switch). I got it on the first try so its not that hard.
customer_reviews.author: C. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Return window closed at the end of January. They stopped working in February. When they worked it was awesome! But not worth the cost of only working for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: KCV

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Echo Plus
customer_reviews.text: Paired easily with our Echo Plus (our only hub) and works perfectly. Great addition to our smart home.
customer_reviews.author: YipperSkipper

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: These Smart switches are great to be replaced with regular switches. it works great with Alexa and mobile devices!!
customer_reviews.author: Sree Yadavalli

customer_reviews.title: It works great with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install since it brings easy instructions to follow and it also works great with Alexa. This is my second smart GE switch that I have installed. my son had recommended this switch to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: GE Zigbee Smart Dimmer In-Wall Lighting Control, Neutral Wire Required, Works Directly with Alexa Plus, Echo Show (2nd Gen), White & Light Almond, 45857GE
product_meta.description: Style:In-Wall Dimmer| Color:White & Light AlmondCustomize your home automation with a GE-branded ZigBee In-Wall Smart Dimmer. Compatible with all ZigBee-certified gateways, the smart dimmer provides wireless control of your home’s hardwired lights with your mobile device, computer or ZigBee‑enabled remote. Not only will the smart dimmer help cut energy costs and extend the life of your bulbs, but it also boosts home safety by creating a well-lit, lived-in appearance. The smart dimmer provides ultimate flexibility to create custom scenes, schedule events and adjust brightness levels in your home at any time from everywhere. Easy installation allows the smart dimmer to replace any existing switch equipped with a neutral wire in single-pole or three-way setups, and easily changeable paddles match your home’s décor. White and light almond paddles are included, and additional colors are available. Simplify your smart home experience with a GE-branded ZigBee In-Wall Smart Dimmer.
feature_bullets: ALEXA COMPATIBLE – The smart dimmer connects to Echo Plus and Echo Show (2nd gen) without a separate hub for voice control with Alexa. It is also compatible with all other Alexa devices through a certified hub.

SUPPORTED HUBS – Works with hubs from SmartThings, Wink, PEQ and Logitech Harmony Home Hub Extender as well as home systems by your favorite cable companies, including Cox, Rogers, Comcast Xfinity and Comporium. It is not compatible with Philips Hue (ZigBee Light Link – ZLL).

NEUTRAL WIRE REQUIRED – Features space-saving screw terminal and uses existing wiring to upgrade any single-pole or multi-switch installation equipped with a neutral wire. Max load supports 600W incandescent and 150W dimmable LED/CFL.

REMOTE OPERATION – Mobile devices wirelessly schedule and control the ON/OFF and brightness functions of permanently installed dimmable LED, CFL, incandescent and halogen lighting. Energy reporting provides valuable information and automations to reduce electrical costs. The wireless range is up to 150feet. from the controller or closest ZigBee device.

INTERCHANGEABLE PADDLES – Includes white and light almond rocker-style paddles to match existing décor (black, brown and ivory sold separately) and features an LED indicator to show dimmer location. Wall plate is not included. Operating Temperature: 77°F (25°C)

specifications.Included Components: In-wall dimmer, Colored paddles, User manual
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars378 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
